alert.note: Alert for Southern Seward Peninsula Coast (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Blizzard Warning issued March 04 at 1:26PM AKST until March 06 at 6:00AM AKST by NWS Fairbanks
info.description: ...BLIZZARD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 6 AM AKST MONDAY... * WHAT...Blizzard conditions expected. Total snow accumulations of 8 to 18 inches and ice accumulations of around one tenth of an inch. Winds gusting as high as 65 mph. * WHERE...Southern Seward Peninsula Coast. * WHEN...From 6 PM this evening to 6 AM AKST Monday. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult to impossible. Areas of blowing snow could significantly reduce visibility. Very strong winds could cause extensive damage to power lines. The cold wind chills as low as 30 below zero could cause frostbite on exposed skin in as little as 30 minutes. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...A series of weather fronts will produce periods of snow through the weekend and into Monday.
info.instruction: A Blizzard Warning means severe winter weather conditions are expected or occurring. Falling and blowing snow with strong winds and poor visibilities are likely. This will lead to whiteout conditions, making travel extremely difficult.
